item.name: Talkstalk
item.text:
Once consumed, you learn a new language and forget the languages you know for a day. However, after a day you still know the new language. A creature can only be affected by this fungus once a day.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 20 (Homebrew)

item.name: Carrollstalk
item.detail: flora, red and blue striped mushroom
item.text:
Once consumed, you are under the effects of the reduce/enlarge spell for 1 minute.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 21 (Homebrew)

item.name: Eddybell
item.text:
Once consumed, you gain the benefits of consuming a day's worth of rations.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 26 (Homebrew)

item.name: Rock Fungi
item.text:
Once consumed, your skin hardens and your AC raises by 1 for 1 minute.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 27 (Homebrew)

item.name: Dis Lichen
item.text:
Once consumed, you make all Charisma checks at disadvantage for 24 hours.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 32 (Homebrew)

item.name: Glowbell
item.text:
This fungus acts as a light source, casting bright light for 20 feet and dim light for another 10 feet. Some Underworld humanoids use it like a lantern. Once consumed, you gain the ability to cast the light spell once, requiring no components, and the light has the same blue color as the fungus. This ability wears off after one hour if not used.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 52 (Homebrew)

item.name: Water of Forgetfulness
item.text:
This dark water was taken from the River of Forgetfulness, which flows swiftly through the Underworld. Any creature that drink this water (or straight from the river) must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or forget what occurred in the last eight hours.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 56 (Homebrew)

item.name: Dark Crystals
item.text:
Dark purple crystals found in the darkest areas of the Underworld. Their dust can be inhaled to heal 1d8 hit points.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 63 (Homebrew)

item.name: Green Salt
item.text:
Once consumed, any food you eat in the next hour tastes delicious.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 65 (Homebrew)

item.name: Adora Spora
item.text:
Once consumed, you are charmed by the closest humanoid within 60 feet for 10 minutes. The effect ends if you take any damage.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 89 (Homebrew)

item.name: Volcanus
item.text:
A toxic black gas that leaks from fissures in the rock. Any creature within 10 ft. must make a successful DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 1d4 poison damage and remain poisoned for 10 minutes.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 91 (Homebrew)

item.name: Sparks-in-the-Dark
item.text:
These right white spheres float and cast bright light for 10 minutes. If touched, they will explode and blind any creature within 30 ft. that doesn't make a successful DC 13 Constitution saving throw.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 93 (Homebrew)

item.name: Undermungus
item.text:
Once consumed, you have darkvision (60 ft.) for a day.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 94 (Homebrew)

item.name: Emerald Fish
item.detail: tiny emerald green fish that glows in the dark
item.text:
These bioluminescent fish glow green and cast bright light for 20 ft. Drow use them in lanterns throughout their cities.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 98 (Homebrew)

item.name: Truthstalk
item.text:
Once consumed, you must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be compelled to tell the truth for one day. This fungus only affects humanoids.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 100 (Homebrew)

item.name: Pungus
item.text:
Once consumed, this very smelly mushroom makes you funny for a day and you have +1 to Charisma checks.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 101 (Homebrew)

item.name: Mad Moss
item.text:
Once consumed, you must make a successful DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or suffer the effects of the confusion spell for 1 minute.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 113 (Homebrew)

item.name: Gloomstalk
item.text:
Once consumed, you are depressed for a day.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 114 (Homebrew)

item.name: Dark Spores
item.text:
Clouds of these intelligent, evil spores are being spread by the Undervoid. Any creature within 10 feet of these spores must make a successful DC 13 Constitution saving throw or suffer one of the following random effects (roll 1d6):
1. You become infected. See 'Spores Burst' in the Fungahshaman stat block on page 52 in Monsters of the Underworld. 2. -1 to your Constitution modifier for a day. 3. You take 1d4 poison damage. 4. The area in a 30-foot radius around you becomes lightly obscured by spores for 10 minutes. 5. You speak only in Primordial for 1 day. 6. Your alignment changes to neutral evil for 10 minutes.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 115 (Homebrew)

item.name: Fire Crystals
item.text:
Yellowish-orange crystals that grow on cavern walls. Once placed on your forehead, you gain advantage on all initiative rolls for 1 day.
Source: Monsters of the Underworld p. 116 (Homebrew)
